thread.title: Clippers' Chris Paul medically cleared, could play against Warriors
thread.title_full: Clippers' Chris Paul medically cleared, could play against Warriors

author: Gabrielle McMillen (gabrielle.McMillen@performgroup.com)
title: Clippers' Chris Paul medically cleared, could play against Warriors
text:
NBA February 22, 2017 4:14pm   4:14pm EST Basketball, NBA, News, Los Angeles Clippers, English, Chris Paul, Doc Rivers Clippers coach Doc Rivers said Chris Paul has been medically cleared to play and could be on the court against the Warriors on Thursday. Los Angeles Clippers star Chris Paul (Getty Images) 
Updated at 4:14 p.m. ET 
Updated at 4:14 p.m. ET 
Could Chris Paul's anticipated return be Thursday against the Warriors? 
Clippers coach Doc Rivers said it's a possibility after Paul was medically cleared to play Wednesday and had a great practice. 
MORE: Chris Paul verbally agrees to re-sign with Clippers 
Paul is far ahead of his recovery timetable after his Jan. 18 thumb surgery, which listed him out six to eight weeks. According to the team, Paul looked great in practice Wednesday, but they don't want to push him to play Thursday or Friday. 
According to Paul, he doesn't want to be a liability to the team by rushing back to play. 
"When Iâ€™m ready and able to play, trust me, I will," Paul said . Watch This
